page.title: 02CARDROSS _ LANDSCAPE
page.content: {RESIDENTIAL-}LESS THAN 1 QUARTER OF 1KM.SQUARE IN OUR BLOCK IS RESIDENTIAL; ALL HOUSING POSTWAR WITH ONLY A FEW EXCEPTIONS. {FARMING-}TWO THIRDS OF THE REMAINING LAND IS FARMED, WITH LOW LYING LAND FROM ARDMORE BAY PROVIDING ARABLE AND DAIRY FARMING. AS THE GROUND RISES THE FARMING CHANGES TO MIXED ARABLE, WITH THE HILLS AND MOORS TO THE NORTH PROVIDING ROUGH GRAZING. {RECREATIONAL-}A SMALL PLAY AREA WITH SWINGS IS ADJACENT TO THE SCHOOL. {BUILDINGS OF INTEREST-}INCLUDE ST. MAHEW'S CHAPEL, THE DOVECOT, AND THE RUINS OF KILMAHEW CASTLE. CARDROSS CREMATORIUM OVERLOOKS ARDMORE AND THE CLYDE. { {}
